dt: region of northern Africa between the Atlantic and the upper Nile River south of the Sahara Desert including the basins of Lake Chad and the Niger River and the upper Nile

, a territory under joint British and Egyptian rule, became an independent republic in 1956 with Khartoum its capital. Conflict between the northern and southern sections of that country resulted in it splitting into the current country of Sudan (sense 3 below) and {d_link|South Sudan|South Sudan:g}, which formally gained independent status in 2011.
country bordering the Red Sea in northeastern Africa south of Egypt; capital Khartoum {it}area{/it} 718,723 square miles (1,861,484 square kilometers), {it}population{/it} 43,121,000
